definitions.definition: the lowest tone or part in music, for instruments or voices

examples.text: He always plays his stereo with the bass turned right up.

definitions.definition: an electric guitar that plays very low notes
a man’s singing voice with a low range; a man with a bass voice

examples.text: He answered my question in a surprisingly deep bass.

definitions.definition: a musical part that is written for a bass voice
the largest musical instrument in the violin family, which plays very low notes

wordOrigin: late Middle English: alteration of the adjective base.
